localylabel: Arctic sea ice area (million sq km)
globalylabel: Global sea ice area (million sq km)
annotation: In 1979, satellite measurements of Arctic sea ice begin.
title: Sea ice decline
moreinfo: The Arctic is the fastest warming region in the world. Climate models predict that the Arctic will be sea ice-free in the summer by the 2030s.

globaldatasrctext: Global sea ice coverage from satellite data: Annual cycle and 35-yr trends

annotation: On August 21, the Northwest Passage became open to ships without the help of an icebreaker.
Arctic sea ice reaches a minimum extent of 3.41 million sq km, a record low since satellite measurements began.
Ice greater than 4 years old accounted for only 7% of all Arctic sea ice, compared to 26% in 1988.
